text:
Hi there!
I´m trying to create a rule to send an email by workflows, but I only have the opportunity to send it for all the contacts.
I would like to send only to a specific ticket property.
Has anyone tried (or done) this before?
What type of workflow is this (i.e. contact based, deal based)?

Ok, I haven't used that but have used deal based, which looks like this. My understanding is the workflow will send the email to any contacts associated with the object (in this case, a ticket) by default. However you can assign association labels to contacts, which allows you to only send the email to the contacts that have that label, by choosing it instead of using "All contacts". For example, you might have a primary contact and secondary contact associated to an object, but you only want those with the primary contact label to be sent the email.

I am assuming by, "I would like to send only to a specific ticket property.", you meant you want to send the email to an email address stored in a ticket property? I don't think that would be possible, but maybe someone else knows otherwise.

Many thanks! Yes, when the ticket is create, the workflow store the email inside the "email propertie". We aren´t using the association´s labels.
But I think this is the only way to do this.

You may also want to check <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/choose-your-workflow-actions#send-email-marketing-hub-and-service-hub-professional-and-enterprise-only|this article> as it mentions some restrictions related to tickets and the "send email" action depending on your hub subscriptions, not sure if it applies in your case.
